list.name: Changes
list.comment:
Pretty big changes again:
1. GUI - Some small GUI fixes, such as the spacing on the dialog pane disappearing when you click on it. - Debug mode added. - Undo move functionality added.
2. General - Moved all the logic for generating the attacking squares for both sides in the board class. - Moved isLegalMove to the board class. - Attacking squares are now bitboards, instead of lists of list of ints - Attacking squares are now calculated only at the start of the game, and then updated as needed. - PrecomputedGameData class added, because otherwise we would have some precomputed data in MoveGenerator and some in Board, so all that data is now stored in its own separate class. - All these changes brought down the time required for go perft at the start position with a depth of 5, from 17 seconds to about 7.5. So over 50% faster

task.summary: I forgot what I did here
small fix in GUI. Legal moves list was not emptied after the second click + Other small changes
Fix for thinker engine. Added alpha beta pruning

Massive changes to pretty much everything.
Game changes: - Pieces are not represented by integers instead of a Piece object. - Move has been changed to hold all the information in an int. It now also has flags, they are used to know what the nature of the move is (eg. en passant). If move is a promotion, it also holds information about the piece that the pawn will be promoted to. - Board now works with a 1D array of integers, instead of a 2D array of Pieces (This goes with the Piece changes). - Board now has HashMap containing piece positions for each color, so now we don't have to go through the whole board to find the pieces. - GUI has been changed a bit, because it was pretty stupid before.
Move generation changes: - There is now a hashmap called edgeOfBoard, that can tell us how many steps we can take in a direction before going off the edge of the board. This was made because of the board now being a 1D array. - generateMoves now also calculates squares attacked by the enemy and pin lines, they are used later. - isLegalMove was moved to MoveGenerator and changed completely. Now it doesn't scan from the king to find checks, it instead looks through squares attacked by the enemy and through the pin lines to figure out if a move is legal.
Changed GUI so now it used mousePressed instead of mouseClicked. This resolves the issue where sometimes clicks aren't detected

Massive changes to GUI. - Board now has coordinates - Left and right panels have been added to the board, in order to display information and buttons - Reset board, flip board, set up board from fen, go perft functionality has been added to GUI - Dialog box has been added in order to display messages and perft results - Left panel is pretty much done, as far as I can tell

Small changes to the left panel of the GUI to make it a bit nicer to use
- text gets removed from fen input and depth input after their respective button is pressed - some warnings removed from GamePanel
Promotion functionality has been added to GUI

Massive speed improvements for counter. Went from 1:03 for start position with depth 5, to 0:17.
- Zobrist hashing is now used to keep track of seen positions. This was about a 10% improvement in speed. - New moves aren't generated anymore for every piece to check the game over state. Now as soon as we find one piece with legal moves, we return true. This cut the perft time in half. - UnmakeMove function was made in board. Now deepCopies aren't made anymore to return board to state before the move. This again cut the perft time in half. - Several small bug fixes.

Pretty big changes again:
1. GUI - Some small GUI fixes, such as the spacing on the dialog pane disappearing when you click on it. - Debug mode added. - Undo move functionality added.
2. General - Moved all the logic for generating the attacking squares for both sides in the board class. - Moved isLegalMove to the board class. - Attacking squares are now bitboards, instead of lists of list of ints - Attacking squares are now calculated only at the start of the game, and then updated as needed. - PrecomputedGameData class added, because otherwise we would have some precomputed data in MoveGenerator and some in Board, so all that data is now stored in its own separate class. - All these changes brought down the time required for go perft at the start position with a depth of 5, from 17 seconds to about 7.5. So over 50% faster

Fix for thinker engine. Added alpha beta pruning

Massive changes to pretty much everything.
Game changes: - Pieces are not represented by integers instead of a Piece object. - Move has been changed to hold all the information in an int. It now also has flags, they are used to know what the nature of the move is (eg. en passant). If move is a promotion, it also holds information about the piece that the pawn will be promoted to. - Board now works with a 1D array of integers, instead of a 2D array of Pieces (This goes with the Piece changes). - Board now has HashMap containing piece positions for each color, so now we don't have to go through the whole board to find the pieces. - GUI has been changed a bit, because it was pretty stupid before.

This was made because of the board now being a 1D array. - generateMoves now also calculates squares attacked by the enemy and pin lines, they are used later. - isLegalMove was moved to MoveGenerator and changed completely. Now it doesn't scan from the king to find checks, it instead looks through squares attacked by the enemy and through the pin lines to figure out if a move is legal.

- text gets removed from fen input and depth input after their respective button is pressed - some warnings removed from GamePanel
Promotion functionality has been added to GUI

Massive speed improvements for counter. Went from 1:03 for start position with depth 5, to 0:17.
- Zobrist hashing is now used to keep track of seen positions. This was about a 10% improvement in speed. - New moves aren't generated anymore for every piece to check the game over state. Now as soon as we find one piece with legal moves, we return true. This cut the perft time in half. - UnmakeMove function was made in board. Now deepCopies aren't made anymore to return board to state before the move. This again cut the perft time in half. - Several small bug fixes.

Pretty big changes again:
1. GUI - Some small GUI fixes, such as the spacing on the dialog pane disappearing when you click on it. - Debug mode added. - Undo move functionality added.
2. General - Moved all the logic for generating the attacking squares for both sides in the board class. - Moved isLegalMove to the board class. - Attacking squares are now bitboards, instead of lists of list of ints - Attacking squares are now calculated only at the start of the game, and then updated as needed. - PrecomputedGameData class added, because otherwise we would have some precomputed data in MoveGenerator and some in Board, so all that data is now stored in its own separate class. - All these changes brought down the time required for go perft at the start position with a depth of 5, from 17 seconds to about 7.5. So over 50% faster

option.name: LAST_COMMIT_MESSAGE
option.value:
Pretty big changes again:
1. GUI - Some small GUI fixes, such as the spacing on the dialog pane disappearing when you click on it. - Debug mode added. - Undo move functionality added.
2. General - Moved all the logic for generating the attacking squares for both sides in the board class. - Moved isLegalMove to the board class. - Attacking squares are now bitboards, instead of lists of list of ints - Attacking squares are now calculated only at the start of the game, and then updated as needed. - PrecomputedGameData class added, because otherwise we would have some precomputed data in MoveGenerator and some in Board, so all that data is now stored in its own separate class. - All these changes brought down the time required for go perft at the start position with a depth of 5, from 17 seconds to about 7.5. So over 50% faster
